titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Dr. Werner S. Zimmt is a Research Fellow in the Fabrics and Finishes Department of E. I. du Pont de Nemours and Co. A graduate of the University of Chicago, he joined DuPont as a Research Chemist in 1951 and later served as a Staff Chemist and Research Associate before assuming his present position in 1969. Dr. Zimmt is a member of the American Chemical Society, the National Paint, Varnish and Lacquer Association, and is the Mission Manager of the Air Quality Task Force. He is the author of publications in the field of free radical and polymer chemistry and was the 1973 Recipient of the George B. Heckel Award of the NPCA.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of Zimmt's course notes from an introductory Organic Chemistry course in 1947, and a copy of "A Non-H2S Scheme of Qualitative Analysis" by Paul J. Hartsuch, Chicago, 1941.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
